server
Class Broadcaster

java.lang.Object
  server.Broadcaster

public class Broadcaster
extends java.lang.Object

This thread is established on the server to contain every client's output stream. Whenever the server needs to update the clients, this object is called which iterates through and writes the update to every client's output stream.

Author:
Ryan Hammer

Broadcaster

public Broadcaster(Server server)
Constructs a new Broadcast Thread Object. The server should only ever create one of these.

Parameters:
container - MailBox for incoming messages
Method Detail

getClientCount

public int getClientCount()
Returns the number of client ObjectOutput streams this broadcaster has.

Returns:
The number of client streams

addOut

public void addOut(java.net.Socket client,
                   int clientID)
Adds the ObjectOutputStream to the clients list, so that when an event needs to be sent to all threads It will be sent by iterating over that ObjectOutPutStream list. When a new output stream is added, An object is immediately sent to the client. This object is used to initialize the game for the client.

Parameters:
o - The ObjectOutputStream

contains

public boolean contains(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
Returns whether or not it has the provided ObjectOutputStream

Parameters:
oos - The ObjOutputstream to look for.
Returns:
whether or not it has the oos.

removeOut

public void removeOut(int clientID)
Method used by server if it loses a connection to a client. This will remove the output stream from the client.

Parameters:
clientID - The client to remove.

broadcastUpdate

public void broadcastUpdate(GladdosUpdate update)
Sends a server update out to all of the currently connected clients.

Parameters:
update - The update to send out.
